result.execSummary:
The defendant David W. Albright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served.
Concurrent with: Waushara County Case No. 14CM71

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity.
Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 14CF135 & 14CM71 Cases called @ 1:35 p.m. Defendant David W. Albright in court with attorney Jared Redfield.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF135 -  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Possession of THC contrary to Wis State 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea: Cts 1 & 4 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. 14CM71 - Defendant admits that a violation has occurred. The court finds that a violation has occurres, vacates the PPDA and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: 14CM71 - 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician,  not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity, DAAP, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. 14CF135 - 6 mos jail as to each count consecutive to each other and any other existing sentence - Huber, GT, No CFTS -  I/S - 2 years probation concurrent- Conditions: Same conditions as 14CM71.  Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 3, 2014 at 02:20 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

14CF135 & 14CM71 Cases called @ 2:36 p.m. Defendant David W. Albright in court with attorney Jared Redfield.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF135 -   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG plea as to each count. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Redfield. Court orders: $2500 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. 14CM71 to track along with 14CF135.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 02:20 pm.
Initial appearance on October 1, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
